text: Lamonta was a town located in Jefferson County, Oregon, United States, established in 1890, and abandoned in 1934. Located along The Dalles-John Day stage route, Lamonta contained a post office, school, blacksmith, livery, hotel, stores, four saloons and a dance hall. Following a series of crop failures and droughts in the 1920s, Lamonta was mostly abandoned by 1934. By 1939, Lamonta was considered a ghost town. ==References== Category:1890 establishments in Oregon Category:Populated places established in 1890 Category:1934 disestablishments in Oregon Category:Former populated places in Jefferson County, Oregon Category:Ghost towns in Oregon
title: Lamonta, Oregon
